thread.title: See 18 iconic race cars shine on NASCAR Hall of Fame's Glory Road
thread.title_full: See 18 iconic race cars shine on NASCAR Hall of Fame's Glory Road

title: See 18 iconic race cars shine on NASCAR Hall of Fame's Glory Road
text:
See 18 iconic race cars shine on NASCAR Hall of Fame’s Glory Road Chase Wilhelm Jan 6, 2017 at 12:21p ET 0Shares Glory Road 
On Friday in Charlotte, North Carolina, the NASCAR Hall of Fame unveiled the latest editions to their Glory Road, highlighted by Davey Allison's famous No. 28 Havoline Ford Thunderbird. 
Check out all 18 iconic cars: FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Marshall Teague’s 1952 Hudson Hornet 
Nicknamed the “King of the Beach” for his success on the Daytona Beach Road Course, Teague joined the Hudson Motors team and drove the “Fabulous Hudson Hornet” stocks cars in 1951 and 1952. Competing in 23 NASCAR Grand National events from 1949 through 1952, Teague won seven races. 
Another fun fact: Teague’s Hudson Hornet was also the inspiration for the Doc Hudson character in Disney’s Cars film. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Fireball Robert’s 1957 Ford Fairlane 
In 206 NASCAR Grand National races, Roberts won 33 times. He also earned the NASCAR Grand National Series Most Popular Driver honor driving this car in 1957. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Richard Petty’s 1964 Plymouth Belvedere 
Petty drove this Plymouth Belvedere to nine NASCAR Grand National Series wins in 1964, including the Daytona 500. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Wendell Scott’s 1966 Ford Galaxie 
The 2015 NASCAR Hall of Fame inductee became the first African-American to win a race at NASCAR’s highest level, winning the Jacksonville 200 at Jacksonville Speedway in 1963. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen David Pearson’s 1966 Dodge Charger 
In 574 races in NASCAR’s top series, Pearson earned 105 wins, leaving him second on the all-time wins list behind Richard Petty’s 200 victories. The “Silver Fox” also drove this race car to a championship in 1966. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Richie Evans’ 1939 Chevrolet Coupe (driven from 1970-1971) 
Evans earned his first NASCAR Modified Division championship in 1973. He won another one in 1978, which began a remarkable stretch of seven more titles through 1984. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Darrell Waltrip’s 1976 Chevrolet Monte Carlo 
The three-time NASCAR Cup Series champion and current FOX NASCAR analyst earned 84 wins in 809 races. In 1976, Gatorade became the primary sponsor of Waltrip’s No. 88 DiGard Chevrolet, which he drove to one victory in the Virginia 500 at Martinsville Speedway. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Bobby Allison’s 1978 Ford Thunderbird 
Over the course of his 25-year NASCAR Cup Series career, Allison earned one championship and 84 wins. In 1978, he scored four victories in this car owned by Bud Moore, including the Daytona 500. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Bobby Allison’s 1978 Ford Thunderbird 
FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Sam Ard’s 1982 Oldsmobile Omega 
Ard earned two championships and 22 victories in what is now the NASCAR XFINITY Series while driving the No. 00. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Davey Allison’s 1987 Ford Thunderbird 
In his first season driving the iconic No. 28 Ranier-Lundy Ford Thunderbird in 1987, Allison earned two wins at Rockingham Speedway and Dover International Speedway. During his nine-year NASCAR Cup Series career, which was cut short after a fatal helicopter crash at Talladega Superspeedway on July 12, 1992, he earned 19 career victories. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Neil Bonnett’s 1989 Ford Thunderbird 
Although Bonnett never earned a victory in the famous Wood Brothers No. 21 in 1989, he did accumulate 18 wins in 362 races in the NASCAR Cup Series. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Neil Bonnett’s 1989 Ford Thunderbird 
FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Harry Gant’s 1991 Oldsmobile Cutlass 
Also known as “Handsome Harry,” Gant earned five wins, 15 top fives and 17 top-10 finishes in 1991, including an impressive stretch of four straight victories at Darlington, Richmond, Dover and Martinsville during the month of September. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Bill Elliott’s 1992 Ford Thunderbird 
Elliott came very close to winning a second championship in this No. 11 Ford Thunderbird, losing the title to Alan Kulwicki by 10 points despite winning the final race at Atlanta Motor Speedway, one of NASCAR’s most historic races to this day. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Bill Elliott’s 1992 Ford Thunderbird 
FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Mike Skinner’s 1995 Chevrolet Silverado 
Skinner drove this No. 3 truck for Richard Childress Racing during the inaugural NASCAR SuperTruck Series, which is now known as the Camping World Truck Series. He won the first race at Phoenix International Raceway and collected seven more victories en route to capturing the first championship. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Dale Earnhardt’s 1999 Chevrolet Monte Carlo 
FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Dale Earnhardt’s 1999 Chevrolet Monte Carlo 
FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Jeff Gordon’s 2005 Chevrolet Monte Carlo 
The four-time NASCAR Cup Series champion and FOX NASCAR analyst piloted this No. 24 Hendrick Motorsports Chevy to his third career Daytona 500 victory in 2005. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Jimmie Johnson’s 2013 Chevrolet SS 
Johnson started the 2013 season by winning his second Daytona 500 in this Generation 6 ride. He later went on to earn his sixth NASCAR Cup Series championship. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Jimmie Johnson’s 2013 Chevrolet SS 
FOXSports.com Tom Jensen Kyle Busch’s 2015 Toyota Camry 
After missing part of the 2015 NASCAR Cup Series season due to a serious leg injury suffered in the NASCAR XFINITY Series season opener at Daytona, Busch made a remarkable comeback to win his first championship. FOXSports.com Tom Jensen
